page.title: 11HURLEY VILLAGE & AREA
page.content: {THE LOCK AT HURLEY Hurley Lock is one of ten locks between Hurley and Windsor.It is owned by the Thames Conservancy Division.There is an accompanying lock keepers house.Pleasure craft are the most common users of the lock with 40,000 a year passing through,mainly of course in summer. There are a series of weirs nearby. {HISTORIC HURLEY The Thameside village of Hurley was mentioned in the Domesday Book.The cloisters of a 10th century Benedictine monastery adjoining the church of St. Mary the Virgin are enclosed on the remaining three sides by the original refectory and dormitory and the late school house all of which are now private houses.
